availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Perry W. Stewart (Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Son of John Stewart and Mary Stewart. Married to Ann Sanders Hedget Stewart in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1847. Father of George W. Stewart. Married to Margaret White Stewart in Harrison County on November 6, 1857. Father of Ann Stewart, James Stewart, Lucy Stewart, and Lucretia Stewart. Farmer in Harrison County in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Employed John Coppage as a farm hand in Harrison County in 1860. Justice of the Peace in Harrison County in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 149B.

Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Harrison County Administrators Bonds, 1863-1869, p. 309.
KYR-0001-031-0046.
